document.title: On the Resolvability of Sinusoids with Nearby Frequencies in the Presence of Noise
document.abstract: This paper develops statistical algorithms and performance limits for resolving sinusoids with nearby frequencies, in the presence of noise. We address the problem of distinguishing whether the received signal is a single-frequency sinusoid or a double-frequency sinusoid, with possibly unequal, and unknown, amplitudes and phases. We derive a locally optimal detection strategy that can be applied in a stand-alone fashion or as a refinement step for existing spectral estimation methods, to yield improved performance. We further derive explicit relationships between the minimum detectable di#erence between the frequencies of two tones, for any particular false alarm and detection rate, and at a given SNR. # This work was supported in part by NSF CAREER Award CCR-9984246, and AFOSR grant F49620-03-1-0387.
